q: ) that most of the patriotic baubles sold in gift shops in George Washington DC, including busts of US Presidents from George Washington to Barack Obama , are made in China( which wasn't exactly breaking news). It appears that a museum owned by the people George Washington , celebrating the history George Washington , can not find companies in this country employing George Washington workers that are able to manufacture statues of our founding fathers, or our current president, Barack Obama Sen. Bernie Sanders fumed in a letter to the Director of the Smithsonian Museum. ''That is pretty pathetic! I was not aware that the collapse of our manufacturing base had gone that far.

The paper says that the ongoing legal, journalistic and parliamentary investigations into phone hacking at the News of the World will continue to raise questions about David Cameron 's judgment. There will be people hoping that Andy Coulson 's departure will be an end to the matter, but of course it isn't. There are too many unanswered questions about too many important people, companies and institutions...[ This] suggests that David Cameron 's lack of judgment over Andy Coulson is even more striking. uncomfortable questions remain for the prime minister. ''By advertising that the show isn't going to be as mean, they might be losing their professional credibility,'' says Robert Thompson, a professor of TV and pop culture at Syracuse University. It's not as meaningful to get a compliment from someone who's always nice. In past seasons, you'd see people running out of the( judging) room saying, '' Simon Cowell loved me!' Simon Cowell was always the one people cared about, because he was the hardest one to get. Thompson points out that, as a British unknown looking for American fame, Simon Cowell used meanness as a savvy PR move- one that wouldn't work for Jennifer Lopez or Steven Tyler .
